message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the task of virtual try-on, which involves fitting an in-shop cloth image on the image of a person while preserving its patterns and characteristics. This task is highly challenging and requires geometric transformations of the cloth to be applied on the target person. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a siamese U-net generator whose skip connections are geometrically transformed by a convolutional geometric matcher, which involves geometric transformations of feature maps. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Graphics (cs.GR) sub-category. Furthermore, the paper involves training an end-to-end architecture with a multi-task loss including an adversarial one, which involves machine learning techniques. Therefore, the paper may also belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM), Machine Learning (cs.LG), and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories.
